body.p:
November 8th 1863
To the Honarbe Govener of Kentucky
Mr Bramlet

Sir Wee your petishioners would most respectively ask your honor to grant John S. Fuqua the privlige of vending Spiritilous liquors any where in the State of Kentucky without paying a lison there for we ask this for Several reasons Some of which we here gave to your honor because he has lost his health in the U.S. Servis he has been a volunteer in the 17th Regment of Ky valenteers infatry faught bravely at Fort Donelson and Served faithly untill Honerable discharged for Hemopituss and Tuburcollosis in his lunges all prodused in consequences of exposure in his continuens in Servis and consequently is not able to labor as here to fore to suport his wife and children and because we beleve he would not abuse the privelige by vending Spirits at improper plasis or in any way that would be injurous to the public if your honor would grat him this privlige and forward to him a lison there for we your petitioners as in duty bound will ever pray
P.S. if your honor grant this you will address to Huffs Creek Hancock County Ky To John S Fuqua
